project.teaser: To reach carbon neutrality, cities must adopt new, more adapted energy models for urban mobility, relying on zero-emission and active mobility modes. The uptake of sustainable mobility solutions relies on their inclusivity, affordability and safety, as well as their...
project.objective: To reach carbon neutrality, cities must adopt new, more adapted energy models for urban mobility, relying on zero-emission and active mobility modes. The uptake of sustainable mobility solutions relies on their inclusivity, affordability and safety, as well as their consistency with users’ needs. Through co-creation activities and innovative digital tools, the AMIGOS project will identify present and future mobility challenges for 5 cities (living labs) and 10 urban areas (safety improvement areas). The digital tools include a Mobility Observation Box and an application for the collection of new mobility data, which will feed a big data platform for their analysis and digital twins to visualize mobility scenarios. They will allow urban stakeholders to identify mobility challenges and will serve as a basis for the co-development of adapted mobility solutions: towards reducing traffic, increasing public and active mobility modes, improving safety and co-habitation between different mobilities for the 5 cities, and towards increased safety for the 10 urban areas. Therefore, key stakeholders such as public authorities and vulnerable users will be included in the definition of technological and policy solutions mobility solutions which will be implemented in the cities. Their environmental, safety, economic and social impacts will be assessed, in addition to their medium- and long-term impact and their replicability, in view of their implementation in 5 twin cities.
project.title: Active Mobility Innovations for Green and safe city sOlutionS
project.keywords: mobility, transportation, urban, city, co-creation, inclusivity, active

article.title: Digital tools to transform urban mobility for a sustainable future

result.title: Game On: Using Serious Tabletop Games to Enhance User Engagement and Optimize Requirements Engineering for Smart City Urban Mobility Solutions

details.authors: Yishak Gebremichael, Joanna Saad-Sulonen, Antti Knutas
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the 2024 International Conference on Information Technology for Social Good

result.title: Quality and Risk Management Plan
result.description: Plan for the quality review and evaluation of deliverables, risk predication and mitigation measures in AMIGOSThe plan will consist of a quality management section with detailed measures to ensure the effective achievement of the pre-set objectives of the project, as well as related deliverables and milestones. The risk management section’s role will be to update the pre-identified expected risks in Part 2.2. of the proposal, as well as outline procedures and provide measures for assessing, mitigating and monitoring risks. In close collaboration with WP leads, the coordinator will update the Quality and Risk Management plan every 6 months until project closure.

result.title: Statusbericht zur Umsetzung, Forschung und Entwicklung von IVS-Anwendungen auf nationaler und internationaler Ebene (gemäß IVS-Gesetz)

details.authors: AustriaTech – Gesellschaft des Bundes für technologiepolitische Maßnahmen GmbH
details.publisher: Bundesministgerium Klimaschutz, Umwelt, Energie, Mobilität, Innovation und Technologie

result.title: Date Management, Ethics and Security Plan (DMP) - 2nd version
result.description: Updated version of deliverable D7.2 reflecting the state of affairs regarding the proper handling of data management, ethics and security in the AMIGOS project after the first reporting period.

result.title: Big data platform
result.description: Online platform presenting city mobility, behaviour and safety data, reports on cities’ main urban mobility challenges, related risk factors and the impact on citizens for the interested LLs and SIAs

result.title: Stakeholder engagement strategy
result.description: Locally customized strategy for city authorities to engage and recruit targeted mobility stakeholders for co-creation workshops

result.title: Updated Fotefar mobile application
result.description: Travel behavioural tracking application Fotefar equipped with an integrated stated preference survey and ready for use

result.title: Communication, dissemination, exploitation plan
result.description: "Plan to reach the targeted audiences and to ensure the wide dissemination and exploitation of the results.The plan will encompass dedicated objectives and actions for both the project’s communication as well as dissemination incl. key messages, audiences, products and channels, timing and responsibilities, and will encourage networking with the Cities Mission platform and the other projects of the cluster ""Inclusive, safe, and sustainable transportation"".The CDE plan will be a dynamic document, with revisions in months 18, and 36. Its final version will be published in M48, when the CDE plan will be turned into an exploitation strategy building on the work of partner TREE in T6.3. It will comprise common and individual exploitation strategies for all partners."

result.title: Data Management, Ethics and Security Plan (DMP)
result.description: Plan to ensure proper data management, ethics and security in the AMIGOS projectThe plan will detail the project’s data management policy on privacy, data collection, storage and protection in line with EU law. Part of the plan is the report of the project's Ethics committee.The committee must be consulted on the following points: human participation, personal data protection issues, health and safety.

result.title: Co-creation methodology
result.description: Guide to implementing the AMIGOS co-creation methodology based on travel behaviour and stated preferences, urban models and urban mobility toolboxes

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
